SETTING.NAME: MASTER_CAL
SETTING.label: Master Calibration
SETTING.tooltip: Adjusts radio frequency to correct for hardware differences

SETTING.NAME: USB_CAL
SETTING.label: BFO (USB) Calibration
SETTING.tooltip: Adjusts BFO for best SSB reception. See HF Signals V6 Calibration video

SETTING.NAME: CW_CAL
SETTING.label: CW BFO Calibration
SETTING.value: Adjusts BFO for best CW reception.
SETTING.tooltip: Adjusts BFO for best CW reception. See HF Signals V6 Calibration video

SETTING.NAME: IF1_CAL_ON_OFF_SWITCH
SETTING.label: Enable IF1_CAL?
SETTING.tooltip: Check if you find you are often adjusting the IF on your radio

SETTING.NAME: IF1_CAL
SETTING.label: IF1 Calibration Factor
SETTING.tooltip: Value is 0-255. Factory default is 0 or 255. Dr Lee recommends 0, or 60-85.

SETTING.NAME: IF1_CAL_ADD_SUB
SETTING.label: Subtract IF1 Calibration Factor?
SETTING.tooltip: Check if Calibration factor is to be SUBTRACTED

SETTING.NAME: VFO_A_MODE
SETTING.label: VFO A Mode Last Used Freq

SETTING.NAME: VFO_B_MODE
SETTING.label: VFO B Mode Last Used Freq

SETTING.NAME: TUNING_STEP_INDEX
SETTING.label: Default Step#
SETTING.tooltip: Select the default tuning step

SETTING.NAME: TUNING_STEP1
SETTING.label: Step #1
SETTING.tooltip: Tuning step - leftmost 2 digits *must* be between 1 - 60

SETTING.NAME: TUNING_STEP2
SETTING.label: Step #2
SETTING.tooltip: Tuning step - leftmost 2 digits *must* be between 1 - 60

SETTING.NAME: TUNING_STEP3
SETTING.label: Step #3
SETTING.tooltip: Tuning step - leftmost 2 digits *must* be between 1 - 60

SETTING.NAME: TUNING_STEP4
SETTING.label: Step #4
SETTING.tooltip: Tuning step - leftmost 2 digits *must* be between 1 - 60

SETTING.NAME: TUNING_STEP5
SETTING.label: Step #5
SETTING.tooltip: Tuning step - leftmost 2 digits *must* be between 1 - 60

SETTING.NAME: CW_KEY_TYPE
SETTING.label: CW Key Type
SETTING.tooltip: Select the type of key you are using

SETTING.NAME: CW_SIDETONE
SETTING.label: CW Sidetone(HZ)
SETTING.tooltip: Set your preferred sidetone frequency in HZ

SETTING.NAME: CW_SPEED_WPM
SETTING.label: CW Speed
SETTING.tooltip: Specify how fast (in wpm) that you want your keyer set at

SETTING.NAME: CW_DELAY_MS
SETTING.label: CW delay switching from TX back to RX
SETTING.tooltip: Used to delay (in ms) returning to RX mode when keying.

SETTING.NAME: CW_START_MS
SETTING.label: Delay before starting TX
SETTING.tooltip: Add delay before going into TX mode from RX

SETTING.NAME: USER_CALLSIGN_KEY
SETTING.label: Magic Key validating Callsign
SETTING.tooltip: Enter your Callsign - max 18 characters

SETTING.NAME: USER_CALLSIGN
SETTING.label: Primary call sign
SETTING.tooltip: Enter your Callsign - max 18 characters

SETTING.NAME: QSO_CALLSIGN
SETTING.label: Alt Call sign
SETTING.tooltip: Enter an alternative Callsign (perhaps used for QSOs) - max 18 characters

SETTING.NAME: CW_ADC_ST_FROM
SETTING.label: CW ST Key ADC from
SETTING.tooltip: Starting ADC (0-1023) for straight key down - suggest 0

SETTING.NAME: CW_ADC_ST_TO
SETTING.label: CW ST Key ADC from
SETTING.tooltip: Ending ADC (0-1023) for straight key down - suggest 50

SETTING.NAME: CW_ADC_DOT_FROM
SETTING.label: CW Paddle DOT ADC FROM
SETTING.tooltip: Starting ADC (0-1023) for dot key of paddle pressed - suggest 301

SETTING.NAME: CW_ADC_DOT_TO
SETTING.label: CW Paddle DOT ADC FROM
SETTING.tooltip: Ending ADC (0-1023) for dot key of paddle pressed - suggest 600

SETTING.NAME: CW_ADC_DASH_FROM
SETTING.label: CW Paddle DASH FROM
SETTING.tooltip: Starting ADC (0-1023) for dash key of paddle pressed - suggest 601

SETTING.NAME: CW_ADC_DASH_TO
SETTING.label: CW Paddle DASH TO
SETTING.tooltip: Ending ADC (0-1023) for dash key of paddle pressed suggest 700

SETTING.NAME: CW_ADC_BOTH_FROM
SETTING.label: CW Paddle BOTH pressed FROM
SETTING.tooltip: Starting ADC (0-1023) for both keys of paddle pressed - suggest 51

SETTING.NAME: CW_ADC_BOTH_TO
SETTING.label: CW Paddle BOTH pressed TO
SETTING.tooltip: Ending ADC (0-1023) for both keys of paddle pressed - suggest 300

SETTING.NAME: TUNING_RESTICTIONS
SETTING.label: Tune Control
SETTING.tooltip: Selecting BAND restricts "Band Select Mode" menu to tuning betweem Ham Bands. Selecting NONE means that when you are in "Band Select Mode, you will actually tune up or down by 100KHz.

SETTING.NAME: TX_RESTRICTIONS
SETTING.label: Restrictions on TX
SETTING.tooltip: Select NONE to allow TX at all frequencies. Selecting HAM resrticts TX to HAM bands only

SETTING.NAME: HAM_BAND_COUNT
SETTING.label: Countof HAM Bands:
SETTING.tooltip: Enter the total number of Ham Bands defined (no more than 10)

SETTING.NAME: HAM_BAND_RANGE1_START
SETTING.label: Band 1 Start
SETTING.tooltip: Enter the lowest frquency (in KHz e.g., 14.000.000 would be 14000) for this band

SETTING.NAME: HAM_BAND_RANGE1_END
SETTING.label: Band 1 End
SETTING.tooltip: Enter the highest frquency (in KHz e.g., 14.000.000 would be 14000) for this band

SETTING.NAME: BOOT_INTO_SDR_MODE
SETTING.label: Boot into SDR Mode
SETTING.tooltip: If checked, forces SDR mode on reboot.

SETTING.NAME: SDR_FREQUENCY
SETTING.label: SDR Offset frequency
SETTING.tooltip: Offset in (mhz). Check with your vendor.

SETTING.NAME: WSPR_BAND1_TXFREQ
SETTING.label: TX frequency for Band 1
SETTING.tooltip: Click button to the right to select a TX frequency for this slot

SETTING.NAME: WSPR_BAND2_TXFREQ

SETTING.tooltip: Enter up to 5 characters to name this message

SETTING.NAME: S_METER_LEVELS
SETTING.label: Enable S-Meter?
SETTING.tooltip: Enabling allows you to set ADC levels for each S-Meter level.

SETTING.NAME: S_METER_LEVEL1
SETTING.label: Level 1
SETTING.tooltip: Use the S-Meter Assistant to help determine the best values. Probably max less than 1000, but will depend on your setup.

SETTING.NAME: S_METER_LEVEL2
SETTING.label: Level 2
SETTING.tooltip: Use the S-Meter Assistant to help determine the best values. Probably max less than 1000, but will depend on your setup.

SETTING.NAME: S_METER_LEVEL3

SETTING.tooltip: Use the S-Meter Assistant to help determine the best values. Probably max less than 1000, but will depend on your setup.

SETTING.tooltip: Use the S-Meter Assistant to help determine the best values. Probably max less than 1000, but will depend on your setup.

SETTING.tooltip: Use the S-Meter Assistant to help determine the best values. Probably max less than 1000, but will depend on your setup.

SETTING.NAME: S_METER_LEVEL6

SETTING.tooltip: Use the S-Meter Assistant to help determine the best values. Probably max less than 1000, but will depend on your setup.

SETTING.NAME: S_METER_LEVEL7

SETTING.tooltip: Use the S-Meter Assistant to help determine the best values. Probably max less than 1000, but will depend on your setup.

SETTING.NAME: S_METER_LEVEL8

SETTING.tooltip: Use the S-Meter Assistant to help determine the best values. Probably max less than 1000, but will depend on your setup.

SETTING.NAME: I2C_LCD_MASTER
SETTING.label: Master LCD I2C Address
SETTING.tooltip: Typically 0x27 for most 16x2 and 20x4 LCDs

SETTING.NAME: I2C_LCD_SECOND
SETTING.label: Secondary LCD I2C Address
SETTING.tooltip: I2C address varies depending on jumper settings on I2C "backpack"

SETTING.NAME: I2C_ADDR_SI5351
SETTING.label: Si5351 I2C adderss chip
SETTING.tooltip: This should always be 0 or 0x60 unless you know what you are doing

SETTING.NAME: MESSAGE_LINE
SETTING.label: Message Line?
SETTING.tooltip: Checking leaves VFO-B line empty and so that it can be used for messages (e.g. CW Keyer, etc.). This overrides all other settings.

SETTING.NAME: SCROLLING_DISPLAY
SETTING.label: SCROLLING DISPLAY
SETTING.tooltip: Checking results in the VFO-B line scrolling left continuously. This provides a little more info.

SETTING.NAME: ONE_TWO_LINE_TOGGLE
SETTING.label: One/Two Line Toggle
SETTING.tooltip: Typially VFO-A and Mode are on bottom line while VFO-B is on top. This reverses this display.

SETTING.NAME: STORED_IF_SHIFT
SETTING.label: Preserve IF Shift?
SETTING.tooltip: Checking allows you to set an IF shift value that is maintained across reboots

SETTING.NAME: IF_SHIFTVALUE
SETTING.label: Shift hz (+/-)
SETTING.tooltip: Set to your preferred IF Shift value. Valid values are between -9,999hz and 10,000hz

SETTING.NAME: CW_DISPLAY_FREQ
SETTING.label: In CW Mode, Display TX or RX Freq?
SETTING.tooltip: Select whether your VFO displays the TX or RX Frequency while in CW mode

SETTING.NAME: EXTENDED_KEY1_START
SETTING.label: Key1 Start ADC
SETTING.tooltip: Starting ADC value for this Key. Must be 1023 or less and lower than the End ADC

SETTING.NAME: EXTENDED_KEY1_END
SETTING.label: Key1 End ADC
SETTING.tooltip: Ending ADC value for this Key. Must be 1023 or less and greater than the Start ADC

SETTING.NAME: EXTENDED_KEY1_FUNC
SETTING.label: Key1 Function
SETTING.tooltip: Select what happens when this key is pressed

SETTING.NAME: EXTENDED_KEY2_START
SETTING.label: Key2 Start ADC
SETTING.tooltip: Starting ADC value for this Key. Must be 1023 or less and lower than the End ADC

SETTING.NAME: EXTENDED_KEY2_END
SETTING.label: Key2 End ADC
SETTING.tooltip: Ending ADC value for this Key. Must be 1023 or less and greater than the Start ADC

SETTING.NAME: EXTENDED_KEY2_FUNC
SETTING.label: Key2 Function
SETTING.tooltip: Select what happens when this key is pressed

SETTING.label: Key3 Start ADC
SETTING.tooltip: Starting ADC value for this Key. Must be 1023 or less and lower than the End ADC

SETTING.NAME: EXTENDED_KEY3_END
SETTING.label: Key3 End ADC
SETTING.tooltip: Ending ADC value for this Key. Must be 1023 or less and greater than the Start ADC

SETTING.NAME: EXTENDED_KEY3_FUNC
SETTING.label: Key3 Function
SETTING.tooltip: Select what happens when this key is pressed

SETTING.NAME: CUST_LPF_ENABLED
SETTING.label: Enable Custom LPF
SETTING.tooltip: Select OFF (no LPF functions), STANDARD (Just the basic lines that control the uBITX filter, or EXTENDED (more data lines)

SETTING.NAME: CUST_LPF_FILTER1_ENDFREQ
SETTING.label: Ending frequency of LPF1
SETTING.tooltip: Enter in MHz the lowest frequency that will trigger this set of control lines

SETTING.NAME: CUST_LPF_FILTER2_ENDFREQ
SETTING.label: Ending frequency of LPF2
SETTING.tooltip: Enter in MHz the lowest frequency that will trigger this set of control lines

SETTING.tooltip: Enter in MHz the lowest frequency that will trigger this set of control lines

SETTING.NAME: CUST_LPF_FILTER7_ENDFREQ
SETTING.label: Ending frequency of LPF1
